description: Borrowed from Yiddish צרות‎ (tsores), plural of צרה‎ (tsore, “trouble, problem”), from Hebrew צָרָה‎ (tsará, “trouble, tragedy, calamity”).

examples: You think you got troubles? You should go down there and talk to some of those schnorrers. Still, what chutzbah. It's like the Jewish moral sense, emerging from all that tsuris.
